#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Waves of arrests in Turkey on suspicion of involvement in ' Ergenekon ' organization
#Text=Sunday , January 11 , 2009
#Text=Turkish police arrested two colonels and two lieutenants
#Text=Saturday as part of a wide-reaching probe into a suspected coup plot .
#Text=The arrests are the latest related to an alleged clandestine neonationalist organization referred to as " Ergenekon " .
#Text=The Ergenekon case has had adverse effects on financial markets in Turkey , a candidate for the European Union .

#Text=Turkey 's state-run news service , Anatolian News , reported that the four Turkish army officers were arrested in Istanbul for alleged ties to a right-wing group suspected of conspiring to overthrow the AK Party government . 40 people were detained on Wednesday , including three retired army generals .
#Text=Recep Tayyip Erdoğan Image : World Economic Forum .
#Text=Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and General Ilker Basbug , Chief of the General Staff of the Turkish Armed Forces , held crisis talks on Thursday to discuss the recent waves of arrests .
#Text=General Basbug met with the prime minister after a six-hour meeting with military commanders , including members of the Gendarmerie , Turkish Air Force , and Army .
#Text=After his meeting with the prime minister , General Basbug met with President Abdullah Gul .
#Text=President Abdullah Gul met with Besir Atalay , Turkey 's interior minister .
#Text=The talks between Erdogan and Basbug prompted a spate of selling on the Istanbul Stock Exchange , which fell by six percent on Thursday .
#Text=TUSIAD , the main business association in Turkey , voiced its hope that investigators respect the legal rights of the suspects .
#Text=Turkish media also reported Saturday that law enforcement officials found ammunition and grenades buried near Golbasi lake outside Ankara , supposedly related to the Ergenekon organization .
#Text=According to the Turkish media reports , police found a drawing in the home of former police chief Ibrahim Sahin , which led them to the site .
#Text=Ibrahim Sahin was among the 40 individuals arrested Wednesday .
#Text=This is a regime change , like in the Khomeini and Hitler eras . — Deniz Baykal , leader of the Republican People 's Party
#Text=Deniz Baykal , who heads Turkey 's secular chief opposition party the Republican People 's Party , was critical of the arrests made by police under the AK Party government .
#Text=" We are witnessing a confrontation against the Republic 's core values .
